title: Police: Student charged after bringing loaded ‘ghost gun’ to school in Prince George’s County
summary:
The Prince George's County Police Department said officers took the untraceable gun from a 13-year-old student at Isaac J. Gourdine Middle School.
(DC News Now) — Police said a 13-year-old student faces a number of charges after he brought a loaded guy to Isaac J. Gourdine Middle School Tuesday morning.
The Prince George’s County Police Department (PGPG) said it received a call about the incident around 8:15 a.m. Investigators said the 13-year-old boy showed the gun to other students.
The gun was a “ghost gun,” which has no serial number.
Tuesday afternoon, police said the charges against the student include Loaded Handgun on Person, Dangerous Weapon on School Property.
